intro: Hapalochilus callipes, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees in its native range. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually arranged opposite each other along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain seeds covered in a sticky substance to aid in attachment to host plants. Hapalochilus callipes plays a role in ecological interactions, providing food for certain bird species and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
